results.title: Glimpses of Western India
results.creator_credit: Films Division, Government of India, Ezra Mir and S.N.S Sastry
results.brief_description: Bombay and the sights to see nearby; Malabar Hill and the hanging gardens; the eight century Hindu cave temples of Elephanta island; Nasik and its pilgrims; Aurangabad the Mogul City; tombs of mediaeval kings; the Ellora caves; cave frescoes at Aguiba; the landscape and the life of the people.

results.title: Glimpses of South Australia
results.brief_description: Shows the place at which the colony at South Australia was proclaimed in 1836. Visits Adelaide, and Mount Gambier etc.

results.title: Glimpses of Gandhiji = Glimpses of Ghandhi
results.brief_description: A survey of the life or Mahatma Ghandhiji. Recalls his childhood; student life in England; the launching of the Satyagraha Campaign in South Africa and subsequently in India; and his martyrdom in January 1948 when a whole nation was plunged into mourning.

results.title: Glimpses of enchanting Japan
results.brief_description: A colourful variety of aspects of the land and nature of Japan. Beginning with the new year the film introduces the Grand Shrines of Ise, most honoured of the national shrines; the charming doll festival; the dramatic “water drawing’ rites of Nara are illuminated by torch light; the Mibu pantomime of Kyoto and the Dontaku festival of Hakata. Interspersed are shots of ancient temples and shrines contrasting with ultra-modern structures based on traditional architecture.

results.title: Glimpses of Eastern India
results.brief_description: An American girl visits her former student friend in Calcutta, tours the surrounding district and flies to the Himalayas for a short trip. Shows ancient ruins, village life, cottage industries, handwoven fabrics and magnificent variety of landscape, festivals, temples, a Buddhist monastery, the tea estates, seaside resorts.

results.title: Glimpses of China
results.brief_description: Gives glimpses of life in China and takes a more detailed look at four major cities- Xian, Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou (Canton). Each place shows a part of China as it is today- infinitely varied rapidly changing and a fascinating land of contrasts.
results.description: Gives glimpses of life in China and takes a more detailed look at four major cities- Xian, Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou (Canton). Each place shows a part of China as it is today- infinitely varied rapidly changing and a fascinating land of contrasts.

results.title: Glimpses of China
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Francois Seguillon and Marcel Carriere
results.brief_description: A far-reaching, all embracing picture of the new China that few outsiders have seen in such close detail. For the Canadian film crew the magic name of Norman Bethune, China’s hero doctor of the war years, opened many doors and ensured a smiling welcome. The result is an illuminating view of the people’s republic of Mao Zedong, whose monuments dominate public halls and squares. In Shanghai, Guangzhou, Beijing and Shenyang, in streets, factories, homes and schools, wherever the film turns it witnesses the same selfless dedication to the cause.

results.title: Gliding
results.creator_credit: British Information Services and Frank Gardner
results.brief_description: The increasingly popular sport of gliding as practiced in Britain today. Air and ground shots demonstrate the skills and techniques for taking-off gaining height, flying and landing. An over-all picture of gliding as a family recreation emerges. Former world champion Philip Wills and Ann Burns, holder of four women’s world records, are seen in action.

results.title: Glider in the sky
